Technique: HEWN; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB; SCULPTURED
Name: Shabti of Nebmehyt
Description: The Brussels Museum posseses three shabtis of the "Governor of the Southern Oasis, Nebmehyt". They all come from the excavations of Abydos carried out by E. Amelineau in 1895-1896. This example in limestone is distinguished by a lovely polychromy. The text of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead is written in six horizontal lines.
